publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3530 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Holocaust Memorial Day—That the Parliament welcomes the unanimous decision of the United Nations General Assembly to designate 27 January as Holocaust Remembrance Day; notes that the Assembly urged the nations of the world to observe the day so that future generations will be spared acts of genocide; further notes that the resolution rejects Holocaust denial, encourages countries to develop educational programmes about the horrors of genocide and condemns religious intolerance, incitement, harassment or violence based on ethnic origin or religious belief, and urges all members to play their part in encouraging Holocaust Memorial Day activities in their constituencies and regions during January.

S2M-3530 Holocaust Memorial Day (lodged on 7 November 2005) Stewart Stevenson*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Richard Lochhead*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*, Alex Neil*, Eleanor Scott*, Shiona Baird*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Fergus Ewing*, Michael Matheson*, Bill Butler*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Phil Gallie*, Mike Pringle*, Jim Mather*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-3530 Holocaust Memorial Day (lodged on 7 November 2005) Mr John Swinney*, Jackie Baillie*, Chris Ballance*, Marlyn Glen*
S2M-3530 Holocaust Memorial Day (lodged on 7 November 2005) Scott Barrie*, Mr David Davidson*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3530 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Holocaust Memorial Day—That the Parliament welcomes the unanimous decision of the United Nations General Assembly to designate 27 January as Holocaust Remembrance Day; notes that the Assembly urged the nations of the world to observe the day so that future generations will be spared acts of genocide; further notes that the resolution rejects Holocaust denial, encourages countries to develop educational programmes about the horrors of genocide and condemns religious intolerance, incitement, harassment or violence based on ethnic origin or religious belief, and urges all members to play their part in encouraging Holocaust Memorial Day activities in their constituencies and regions during January. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Richard Lochhead, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Rob Gibson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Christine Grahame, Robin Harper, Alex Neil, Eleanor Scott, Shiona Baird, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Frank McAveety, Fergus Ewing, Michael Matheson, Bill Butler, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Adam Ingram, Phil Gallie, Mike Pringle, Jim Mather, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr John Swinney, Jackie Baillie, Chris Ballance, Marlyn Glen, Scott Barrie, Mr David Davidson, Donald Gorrie, Murray Tosh*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Campbell Martin*
